intro: Ardisia umbrosa, commonly known as the dark ardisia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Ardisia umbrosa typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for shade gardens and landscape design.
